title: How many members does the UN Security Council have, and who are they? - Quora

response.answer_text: The UN Security Council have 15 Members. Five of them are permanent members. This countries are also Great powers and they were victorious in Second World War: United StatesFranceUnited KingdomPeople Republic of ChinaRussian FederationBeside the fact that thy are permanent members, they also holds a huge power. They have ability to veto any resolution in Security Council or even those concerning admission of new members or candidates for Secretary - General. During the Cold war, veto power was used a lot.  Diagram 1: Concept of regional distribution.[1] The rest 10 members are non permanent members. That means that they are changing every two years or less. They are elected on the regional basis and can serve two - year terms. Body presidency rotates every month among its members. Being elected as non permanent member into Security Council can also mean a huge change for smaller countries to promote own foreign policy. Unfortunately, since only Great powers hold the veto power this can and often leads to misusing veto. Current non permanent members are: Bolivia (2017 - 2018)Equatorial Guinea (2018 - 2019)Ethiopia (2017 - 2018)Ivory Coast (2018 - 2019)Kazakhstan (2017 - 2018)Kuwait (2018 - 2019)Netherlands (2018 - 2018)Peru (2018 - 2019)Poland (2018 - 2019)Sweden (2017 - 2018) Picture 1: Current composition of the UN’s Security Council with member states and the date of they membership.[2] Footnotes[1] German FM Heiko Maas calls for UN Security Council reform | DW | 28.09.2018[2] Security Council - general information

Five permanent members: China, France, Russian Federation, the United Kingdom, and the United States, and ten non-permanent members elected for two-year terms by the General Assembly (with end of term year): Belgium (2020)Dominican Republic (2020)Estonia (2021)Germany (2020)Indonesia (2020)Niger (2021)Saint Vincent and the Grenadines (2021)South Africa (2020)Tunisia (2021)Viet Nam (2021)Non-Council Member StatesMore than 50 United Nations Member States have never been Members of the Security Council. A State which is a Member of the United Nations but not of the Security Council may participate, without a vote, in its discussions when the Council considers that country's interests are affected. Both Members and non-members of the United Nations, if they are parties to a dispute being considered by the Council, may be invited to take part, without a vote, in the Council's discussions; the Council sets the conditions for participation by a non-member State. Security Council Presidency The presidency of the Council is held by each of the members in turn for one month, following the English alphabetical order of the Member States names.
